### fixup&#95;13&#95;pcrel() {#a7e640b2e159d95523eb58b80cb80f064}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void adjust::fixup&#95;13&#95;pcrel (unsigned Size, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a> &amp; Fixup, uint64&#95;t &amp; Value, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mccontext">MCContext</a> &#42; Ctx)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
12-bit PC-relative fixup.

Yes, the fixup is 12 bits even though the name says otherwise.

Resolves to: 0000 kkkk kkkk kkkk Offset of 0 (so the result isn&#39;t left-shifted before application).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp/#l00132">132</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp">AVRAsmBackend.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

  labels = {["static"]}>
6-bit fixup for the immediate operand of the STD/LDD family of instructions.

Resolves to: 10q0 qq10 0000 1qqq

### fixup&#95;7&#95;pcrel() {#a7daa33e05e9d8389d7e8e518eb5c9391}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void adjust::fixup&#95;7&#95;pcrel (unsigned Size, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a> &amp; Fixup, uint64&#95;t &amp; Value, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mccontext">MCContext</a> &#42; Ctx)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
7-bit PC-relative fixup.

Resolves to: 0000 00kk kkkk k000 Offset of 0 (so the result is left shifted by 3 bits before application).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp/#l00116">116</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp">AVRAsmBackend.cpp</a>.

### fixup&#95;call() {#a94f440bc48fa8490137415c9d2f80492}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static void adjust::fixup&#95;call (unsigned Size, <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcfixup">MCFixup</a> &amp; Fixup, uint64&#95;t &amp; Value, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mccontext">MCContext</a> &#42; Ctx)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
22-bit absolute fixup.

Resolves to: 1001 kkkk 010k kkkk kkkk kkkk 111k kkkk

Offset of 0 (so the result is left shifted by 3 bits before application).

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp/#l00100">100</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/avr/lib/target/avr/mctargetdesc/avrasmbackend-cpp">AVRAsmBackend.cpp</a>.
